result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
All court costs, surcharges  be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim during the entire sentence.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide  a DNA sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.
COUNT THREE AND FIVE:  see count one.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Credit for 154 days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for zero days.

records.addlTxt: DECISION AND ORDER DENYING MOTION FOR SENTENCE CREDIT
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michael J. Hanrahan, Br. 4, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit in 15CF2444 and 14CM1347.  Filed in 15CF2444.  Defendant's address:  Tyvon Stacy #616428, MSDF, PO Box 05911, Milwaukee, WI  53205-0911.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of SENTENCTING HEARING transcript commencing 09-18-2015 received and filed. (26 Pages.)  CH

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing OCTOBER 15, 2015 received and filed. (25 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTORNEY WILLIAM CROKE.
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Diane S. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x262148016 in court 1x on 8/26/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Diane T. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Count one.
Counts three and five.

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Diane S.  

For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered the Domestic Abuse enhancers struck from Counts 1 and 5.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 48 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 154 days served.  Court ordered 18 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 30 MONTHS Extended Supervision.

Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim during the entire sentence.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Count 1 with credit for 154 days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 5:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecuitve to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. 
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

AS TO COUNTS 1 (AMENDED), 3, & 5:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNTS 2, 4 & 6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered the use of a dangerous weapon enhancer dismissed.

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Witness Jennifer W. in court in custody. Court ordered bench warrant on Jennifer W. withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
For defaulting witness Jennifer W.

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court having been advised 
that witness Jennifer W., had been subpoenaed and served.  Court ordered that a bench warrant be issued for the defaulting witness. Court denies the defense's motion to dismiss. Case passed to 1:30.

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Final Pretrial held. Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Gross.  Exhibit 1 received.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant has another case (2014CM1347), currently calendared for a Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 9-21-2015 at 8:15 am.  There are different victims on cases 2014CM1347 and 2015CF2444.  Case 2015CF2444 transferred to Branch 40, due to the assignment of ADA Kristen Schrank.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 40 on 7-22-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 8-26-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Jennifer W., Tawanda S., Lateena S., ADS (1-24-1988), TMS (12-27-1999 or JGF (7-18-2007), until further order of the Court.  State withdraws exhibit 1.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jennifer W.; Tawanda S.; Lateena S.; ADS dob 1/24/88; TMS dob 12/27/99 or JGF dob 7/18/07

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 3, 4, 5 & 6 on behalf of the Defendant.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
